questiontext.text: What is the seat of the federal authorities in Switzerland (i.e., the de facto capital)?

generalfeedback.text:
There is no de jure capital but the de facto capital and seat of the federal authorities is Bern.

  1. True
  2. False
  3. False
  4. False
  5. False

questiontext.text: What is the derivative of \(f(x) = x^{2} e^{3.2 x}\), evaluated at \(x = 0.5\)?

generalfeedback.text: Using the product rule for \(f(x) = g(x) \cdot h(x)\), where \(g(x) := x^{2}\) and \(h(x) := e^{3.2 x}\), we obtain \[ \begin{aligned} f'(x) &= [g(x) \cdot h(x)]' = g'(x) \cdot h(x) + g(x) \cdot h'(x) \\ &= 2 x^{2 - 1} \cdot e^{3.2 x} + x^{2} \cdot e^{3.2 x} \cdot 3.2 \\ &= e^{3.2 x} \cdot(2 x^1 + 3.2 x^{2}) \\ &= e^{3.2 x} \cdot x^1 \cdot (2 + 3.2 x). \end{aligned} \] Evaluated at \(x = 0.5\), the answer is \[ e^{3.2 \cdot 0.5} \cdot 0.5^1 \cdot (2 + 3.2 \cdot 0.5) = 8.915458. \] Thus, rounded to two digits we have \(f'(0.5) = 8.92\).

questiontext.text: What is the derivative of \(f(x) = x^{8} e^{2.5 x}\), evaluated at \(x = 0.77\)?

generalfeedback.text: Using the product rule for \(f(x) = g(x) \cdot h(x)\), where \(g(x) := x^{8}\) and \(h(x) := e^{2.5 x}\), we obtain \[ \begin{aligned} f'(x) &= [g(x) \cdot h(x)]' = g'(x) \cdot h(x) + g(x) \cdot h'(x) \\ &= 8 x^{8 - 1} \cdot e^{2.5 x} + x^{8} \cdot e^{2.5 x} \cdot 2.5 \\ &= e^{2.5 x} \cdot(8 x^7 + 2.5 x^{8}) \\ &= e^{2.5 x} \cdot x^7 \cdot (8 + 2.5 x). \end{aligned} \] Evaluated at \(x = 0.77\), the answer is \[ e^{2.5 \cdot 0.77} \cdot 0.77^7 \cdot (8 + 2.5 \cdot 0.77) = 10.91899. \] Thus, rounded to two digits we have \(f'(0.77) = 10.92\).

questiontext.text: What is the derivative of \(f(x) = x^{7} e^{2.4 x}\), evaluated at \(x = 0.67\)?

generalfeedback.text: Using the product rule for \(f(x) = g(x) \cdot h(x)\), where \(g(x) := x^{7}\) and \(h(x) := e^{2.4 x}\), we obtain \[ \begin{aligned} f'(x) &= [g(x) \cdot h(x)]' = g'(x) \cdot h(x) + g(x) \cdot h'(x) \\ &= 7 x^{7 - 1} \cdot e^{2.4 x} + x^{7} \cdot e^{2.4 x} \cdot 2.4 \\ &= e^{2.4 x} \cdot(7 x^6 + 2.4 x^{7}) \\ &= e^{2.4 x} \cdot x^6 \cdot (7 + 2.4 x). \end{aligned} \] Evaluated at \(x = 0.67\), the answer is \[ e^{2.4 \cdot 0.67} \cdot 0.67^6 \cdot (7 + 2.4 \cdot 0.67) = 3.887735. \] Thus, rounded to two digits we have \(f'(0.67) = 3.89\).
